page.title: 13SOCIAL LIFE,ST.ALLEN
page.content: Farmers are often too busy or tired to socialise in the evening;there is no definite"local" pub for the area.The weekly livestock market in Truro is a regular meeting-place on Wednesdays, for discussion on farm topics.The community of this block looks towards Truro for most of its entertainment. Most wives shop in Truro weekly;one farm- worker's wife spends each Thurs. there & her son attends toddler-club at the Salvation Army Citadel.Mr. and Mrs.Gay enjoy dancing at Perranwell,& swimming.St.Allen Church is important meeting-place for country families; there is always lively chat after Sunday services.Children rely on parents or friends for car transport to social events & clubs in Truro or Newquay.Some families are related; visits to&from relatives are frequent. Most people know each other well.
